fields.name: Bell pepper (yellow)
fields.comment: halved, seeded, and cut into 12 square pieces

fields.name: Tofu
fields.comment: extra-firm, cut to 1/2- by2- by 1-inch slabs, carefully dried (see note above)

fields.name: Scallions
fields.comment: white and light green parts only, finely chopped

fields.name: Heavy cream
fields.comment: or more, I like a lot

fields.name: Irish whiskey
fields.comment: or whatever you have lying around

fields.name: Tasty 🌮 Soup
fields.directions:
1. Saute onions for 2 minutes.

2. Add crumbles. Cook till brown. 

3. Add ground beef mixture and all other ingredients (do not drain 🌽 or black beans) to slow cooker.

4. Cook on High for 4 hours or Low for 6 hours.

5. Garnish with sour cream and cheddar cheese.

fields.name: Root Veggie Stew
Luberjackie Soup
Lentil Sweet Potato Soup
fields.directions:
Combine all ingredients in a slow cooker. Turn heat on low and cook for 10 hours, adding a little more broth at the end if soup seems too thick

Note: 1 tsp fresh rosemary = 1/8 - 1/4 dried 

1 fresh bay leaf = 1/2 tsp crushed bay leaf

fields.name: Slow Cooker Baked Potatoes
fields.directions:
1. Wrap each potato in foil and place in a 5-to-6-quart slow cooker. Cover and cook on low until potatoes are tender, 8 hours.

2. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high. Add mushrooms and cook 2 minutes, then add broccoli and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring frequently, until broccoli is crisp-tender, 8 minutes.

3. Split potatoes, scoop out flesh, and transfer to a medium bowl, reserving skins. Add broth and yogurt to bowl, then season with salt and pepper and stir until combined; divide among potato skins. Top each stuffed potato with broccoli mixture.

fields.name: Ratatouille
Squash Lasagna
fields.directions:
1. In a bowl, combine squash with sage. 

1. Add salt and pepper to taste.  

1. In another bowl, combine ricotta with milk and parmesan. 

1. Add salt and pepper to taste.

1. Coat the inside of a 5-6 quart slow cooker with non-stick spray. 

1. Place a layer of noodles at the bottom (you will have to break them to make them fit – don’t worry about using little pieces to fill in crevices, it will come out just fine).  

1. Cover with half of the squash mixture, spreading it evenly. 

1. Place another layer of noodles on top, then a layer of spinach and half of the ricotta mixture. 

1. Repeat layers, ending with ricotta. 

1. Sprinkle mozzarella on top. 

1. Cover and cook on low for 3-4 hours (until noodles are tender).

fields.name: Lentil and Kale Goulash
fields.directions:
1. Use a 6-quart slow cooker. 

1. Rinse lentils until the water runs clear, and then put the wet lentils into your slow cooker. 

1. Add diced onion and the chopped garlic. 

1. Add the entire cans of fire roasted chiles and diced tomatoes. (Can also use chopped chiles)

1. Add the kale, dried spices, and stir in the broth. 

1. Cover, and cook on low for 5 to 6 hours, or until the lentils are bite tender and the onion is 
translucent.

fields.name: Vegetable Fried Rice
fields.directions:
1. In a saucepan bring water to a boil. Stir in rice. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
2.  Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. 
3. Add onions, bell pepper, garlic and pepper flakes, to taste. 
4. Cook 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Increase heat to medium-high and stir in cooked rice, green onions and soy sauce. 
6. Stir-fry for 1 minute. 
7.  Add peas and cook 1 minute more. 
8.  Remove from heat. 
9. Add sesame oil and mix well.
10. Garnish with peanuts, if desired.

fields.name: Hashbrown Omelet
fields.directions:
1. In small skillet, cook crumbles until browned. 

1. Mix potatoes, olive oil, onion, green pepper, and black pepper; put into a large skillet. Cover over low heat until underside is crisp and brown. Olive oil may be omitted if using golden potatoes. 

1. Flip the potato mix to brown the other side. 

1. Blend eggs, milk, salt and pepper; pour over potatoes.

1. When egg has set, flip the whole omelette, cook for 1-2 minutes, then flip again. 

1. Top with crumbles, then cheese.

1. Cover; cook over low heat until cheese has melted. 

1. Loosen omelet.

1. Serve in wedges.

fields.name: Sweet and Sour Sauce
fields.directions:
1. Prepare basic sauce and starch water. 

2. Heat up olive oil in pan or wok; add garlic, green onions and ginger to stir-fry for around 2 minutes or until aroma with low fire.

3. Then pour the basic sauce to the wok, bring all the content to a boiling. And add water starch in. Keep on stirring in the process.

4. Add veggies to wok after sauce boils, so the sauce coats the veggies, but they're not swimming. Add a few scoops of rice if too goopy. Cook on high heat until most of the goopiness is gone and the veggies begin to brown. 

5. Serve over rice that has 1 tablespoon soy sauce to 1 cup rice.

fields.name: Ultimate Loaded Potato Soup
fields.directions:
1. In a large skillet cook crumbles until crispy. Add onions, cook until tender.

2. In a large 6 quart soup pot mix onion, broth and potatoes. Heat to a boiling then reduce heat to a simmer cooking about 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

3. In a skillet, melt butter over low heat. Stir in flour with a whisk until smooth. Cook and stir 1 additional minute. Gradually stir in 2 cups of the milk. Pour the milk mixture into the potato mixture. Add remaining 2 cups of milk, salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly with a whisk until mixture is thick and bubbly.

4. Stir in half of the crumbles, sour cream, 2 cups of the cheese and half of the green onions. Cook until heated and the cheese is melted. Evenly top each individual servings with remaining crumbles, cheese and green onions. Serve with hot buttered rolls or crackers.

fields.name: Squash, Chickpea, Red Lentil Stew
fields.directions:
1. Soak chickpeas in enough cold water to cover them by 2 inches for 6 hours or overnight. (Alternatively, use the quick-soak method: Place beans in a large pot with enough water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat. Remove from heat and let stand for 1 hour.) Drain when ready to use.

1. Combine the soaked chickpeas, squash, carrots, onion, lentils, broth, tomato paste, ginger, cumin, salt, saffron and pepper in a 6-quart slow cooker.
    
1. Put on the lid and cook on low until the chickpeas are tender and the lentils have begun to break down, 5 to 6 1/2 hours.
    
1. Stir in lime juice. Serve sprinkled with peanuts and cilantro.

fields.name: Best Tamale Pie
fields.directions:
1. Spray 8-inch skillet with cooking spray. 

1. Add onion; cook over medium heat about 3 minutes, stirring occasionally until crisp-tender. 

1. In slow cooker, mix crumbles, onions, beans and enchilada sauce. In medium bowl, stir corn bread mix, milk, butter and egg just until moistened. 

1. Stir in cheese and chiles. 

1. Spoon over mixture in slow cooker. 

1. Cover; cook on Low heat setting 4 hours 30 minutes to 5 hours 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center of corn bread comes out clean. 

1. Serve tamale pie with sour cream and green onions.

fields.name: Chipotle Black Bean Soup
fields.directions:
1. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. 

1. Add onions and both bell peppers and sauté until beginning to brown, about eight minutes. 

1. Add garlic and cumin; stir one minute. 

1. Transfer mixture to 6-quart slow cooker. 

1. Add beans and chipotle peppers, then 7 cups hot water. 

1. Cover and cook on high until beans are very tender, about 3 hours, but longer if necessary.

1. Transfer four cups bean mixture to blender; puree until smooth. 

1. Return puree to remaining soup in slow cooker. 

1. Stir in lime juice, salt, and pepper. 

1. Adjust seasonings to taste. Ladle soup into bowls. Serve with desired toppings.

fields.name: Barley Risotto with Fennel
fields.directions:
1. Coat a 4-quart or larger slow cooker with cooking spray. 

1. Crush fennel seeds with the bottom of a saucepan. 

1. Combine the fennel seeds, diced fennel, barley (or rice), carrot, shallot and garlic in the slow cooker. 

1. Add broth, 1 cup water and wine, and stir to combine. Cover and cook until the barley (or rice) is tender, but pleasantly chewy, and the risotto is thick and creamy, 2 1/2 to 3 1/2 hours on high or low.

1. Shortly before serving, cook green beans according to package instructions and drain. 

1. Turn off the slow cooker. 

1. Stir the green beans, Parmesan, olives, lemon zest and pepper into the risotto. If it seems dry, heat the remaining 1/2 cup water and stir it into the risotto. 

1. Serve sprinkled with the chopped fennel fronds.

###TIPS & NOTES
Make Ahead Tip: Prepare fennel, carrot, shallot and garlic. Combine broth, 1 cup water and wine. Refrigerate in separate covered containers for up to 1 day.

For easy cleanup, try a slow-cooker liner. These heat-resistant, disposable liners fit neatly inside the insert and help prevent food from sticking to the bottom and sides of your slow cooker.

###NUTRITION
Per serving: 242 calories; 6 g fat (2 g sat, 1 g mono); 9 mg cholesterol; 36 g carbohydrates; 0 g added sugars; 10 g protein; 8 g fiber; 474 mg sodium; 330 mg potassium.

fields.name: Summer Veggie Kebabs
fields.directions:
## Corn Relish (stovetop)

1. To make Corn Relish: Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. 

1. Add tomato, cover, and cook 4 minutes, or until tomato is breaking down. 

1. Add corn kernels, and cook 2 minutes, or until corn is tender. 

1. Stir in vinegar and mustard powder, and cook 1 minute more. Remove from heat. 

1. Mix in basil; season with salt and pepper, if desired.



## Kebabs

1. Whisk together oil, vinegar, and mustard powder in small bowl.

1. Coat grill grate or grill pan with cooking spray, and preheat over medium heat.

1. Thread each of 12 skewers with 1 bell pepper square, 1 zucchini slice, 1 red onion chunk, 1 mushroom, and 1 tomato. 

1. Place skewers on large platter, and brush with vinaigrette mixture. 

1. Season with salt and pepper, if desired.

1. Grill skewers 6 to 8 minutes, turning every 2 minutes, or until vegetables are tender and browned on all sides. 

1. Serve with Corn Relish.

fields.name: Black Bean Soup
fields.directions:
1. Place the beans in a bowl or pot, cover with cold water, and allow to soak overnight *OR* add beans to a medium pot and cover with hot water. 

1. Bring to a boil, then boil for 2 minutes. 

1. Turn off the heat, cover the pot and allow the beans to sit for 1 hour. 

1. Drain the beans and rinse them with cold water.

1. In a medium pot, add beans, vegetable broth, water, onions, bell peppers, and chipotle pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1 1/2 hours. 

1. At that time, add salt, chili powder, and cumin and stir. 

1. Cover and continue simmering for another 30 minutes to 1 hour, until the liquid level is to your liking (anywhere from very thick to a thinner soup is fine!)

1. Taste for seasoning and add more of what it needs. Serve soup in a bowl with sour cream, extra diced bell pepper, avocado, cilantro, tortilla strips, and a lime wedge.




note: 1 lb dried black beans = 5.5-6.5 cup cooked black beans
fields.description: Go gdgh hd gs db hd ch

fields.name: Pop's Dill Pickles
fields.directions:
1. Place cucumbers in a large pot and cover with ice cubes. Let them sit for at least 2 hours but no more than 8. Drain and pat dry.

1. Place the water, vinegar, sugar, pickling salt, and pickling spice into a saucepan. Bring to boil, then simmer for 15 minutes.

1. Sterilize the jars and lids in boiling water for at least 5 minutes. 

1. Cut the cucumbers in half, then cut the halves into eighths.

1. Pack the cucumbers into the hot, sterilized jars. With larger cucumbers, there will only be enough room for 1 layer. 

1. Place 1-2 dill heads and 1 clove of garlic into each jar. 

1. Pour the hot pickling liquid into the jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the rim. 

1. Wipe the rims of the jars with a moist paper towel to remove any food residue. 

1. Top with lids, and screw on rings.

1. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot and fill halfway with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. (Needed about 5/8 full when using the pressure cooker as a stockpot.) 

1. Carefully lower the jars into the pot using a holder. Leave a 2 inch space between the jars. (pressure cooker fit 4 jars)

1. Pour in more boiling water if necessary until the water level is at least 1 inch above the tops of the jars. Bring the water to a full boil, cover the pot, and process for 5 minutes, or the time recommended by your county Extension agent. (Was not able to achieve full boil with the pressure cooker on the glass surface stove.)

1. Remove the jars from the stockpot and place onto a cloth-covered or wood surface, several inches apart, until cool. 

1. Once cool, press the top of each lid with a finger, ensuring that the seal is tight (lid does not move up or down at all). If any jars have not sealed properly, refrigerate them and eat within two weeks. 

1. Store in a cool, dark area, and wait at least 1 week before opening.

fields.name: Slow Cooker Mashed Potatoes
fields.directions:
1. Spray the inside of the slow cooker with cooking spray. 

1. Add chopped potatoes. 

1. Cover and cook 2-3 hours on high or 5-6 hours on low.

1. Add sour cream, milk, garlic, salt, and pepper to potatoes. 

1. Use a hand mixer to blend together all ingredients. 

1. Give them a taste and add more salt if desired. 

1. Serve plain, or with any favorite toppings such as gravy, or cheese and crumbles. 

1. This recipe can easily be doubled for large groups - just increase the cooking time by 1-2 hours.

fields.name: Mom's Zucchini 🍞
fields.directions:
1. Grease and flour two 8 x 4 inch pans. 

2. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).

3. Sift flour, salt, baking powder, soda, and cinnamon together in a bowl.

4. Beat eggs, oil, vanilla, and sugar together in a large bowl. 

5. Add sifted ingredients to the creamed mixture, and beat well. 

6. Stir in zucchini and nuts until well combined. 

7. Pour batter into prepared pans.

8. Bake for 40 to 60 minutes, or until tester inserted in the center comes out clean. 

9. Cool in pan on rack for 20 minutes. Remove bread from pan, and completely cool.

fields.name: Creamy Nutella Popsicles
fields.directions:
1. Place all ingredients in a blender and process until fully blended.

1. Pour into popsicle molds. 

1. Freeze for a few hours, then enjoy.

fields.name: Roasted Potatoes With Mushrooms
fields.directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F. 

2. Spray large rimmed baking sheet with nonstick spray. 

3. Combine potatoes and 2 tablespoons oil in large bowl; toss to coat. Transfer potatoes to prepared sheet. 

4. Roast until tender and brown, stirring occasionally, about 45 minutes.

5. Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. 

6. Add crimini mushrooms; sauté until brown and tender, about 12 minutes. (Potatoes and mushrooms can be made 2 hours ahead. Let stand separately at room temperature.)

7. Add potatoes and remaining 1 tablespoon oil to skillet with mushrooms. 

8. Sauté over medium-high heat until potatoes are crisp and heated through, about 6 minutes. 

9. Season to taste with salt and pepper. 

10. Sprinkle with porcini mushroom powder; toss to coat. 

11. Transfer to bowl, sprinkle with parsley, and serve.

fields.name: Roasted Fingerling Potatoes
fields.directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. 

1. Coat a baking sheet with tin foil (for easier clean up) and coat very well with olive oil cooking spray. 

1. Slice potatoes, onions, and mushrooms then place them along with the garlic (leave the skins on so they don’t burn while roasting) on the baking sheet. 

1. Drizzle the olive oil on top of the veggies along with the sea salt and pepper to taste, toss to coat evenly.

1. Roast in the oven for 15 minutes then toss with a spatula. 

1. Roast for an additional 10 – 15 minutes or until the potatoes are golden brown and tender. 

1. Remove from heat and carefully remove the skins from the garlic cloves then slice. 

1. Add the garlic slices along with chopped parsley to the potatoes and serve.

fields.name: Pita Pizza
fields.directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

1. Spread one side of the pita with olive oil and pizza sauce. 

1. Top with cheese and mushrooms, and season with garlic salt.

1. Line pizza pan with foil and lightly oil.

1. Place pita pizza on pan, and place in oven until cheese completely melts.

fields.name: Vegetarian Lasagna
fields.directions:
1. Combine egg, ricotta, spinach, mushrooms and zucchini in a large bowl.

2. Combine crushed and diced tomatoes and their juice, garlic and crushed red pepper (if using) in a medium bowl.

3. Generously coat a 6-quart or larger slow cooker with cooking spray. 

4. Spread 1 1/2 cups of the tomato mixture in the slow cooker. 

5. Arrange 5 noodles over the sauce, overlapping them slightly and breaking into pieces to cover as much of the sauce as possible. 

6. Spread half of the ricotta-vegetable mixture over the noodles and firmly pat down, then spoon on 1 1/2 cups sauce and sprinkle with 1 cup mozzarella. 

7. Repeat the layering one more time, starting with noodles. 

8. Top with a third layer of noodles. 

9. Evenly spread the remaining tomato sauce over the noodles. 

10. Set aside the remaining 1 cup mozzarella in the refrigerator.

11. Put the lid on the slow cooker and cook on High for 2 hours or on Low for 4 hours. 

12. Turn off the slow cooker, sprinkle the reserved mozzarella on the lasagna, cover and let stand for 10 minutes to melt the cheese.

fields.name: Whole-wheat Macaroni And Cheese
fields.directions:
1. Melt the butter in a sauté pan over medium heat.

2. Whisk in the flour and keep whisking for about 1 - 2 minutes until the roux (which is equal parts flour and butter or oil) starts to darken, but does not burn.

3. Turn the heat down to low and quickly whisk in the milk. Turn the heat back up to medium and keep whisking until the mixture starts to thicken and all lumps of flour are dissolved.

4. Stir in the grated cheese and once it melts mix in the cooked noodles. Season with salt and pepper. 

5. Serve immediately and enjoy!

fields.name: Potato Skins
fields.directions: http://www.wikihow.com/Make-Potato-Skins

fields.name: Four Cheese 🍅 Sauce
fields.directions:
1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium high heat. Add onion and saute until soft and translucent, about 5-6 minutes. Add garlic, salt and pepper and cook 1 additional minute.

1. Add crushed tomatoes, oregano, basil, and bay leaves and simmer covered on low heat for 1 hour or until thick. Remove bay leaves and add the cheeses.

1. If using a food processor, add half the tomato sauce into the bowl of a food processor and process until smooth. Continue with remaining tomato sauce.

1. Season to taste.

1. If not using all the sauce, allow it to cool completely and pour 1 to 2 cup portions into plastic freezer bags.

fields.name: Flatbread 🌮 Pizzas
fields.directions:
1. Spread salsa on flatbread

2. Add toppings 

3. Spread mozzarella

4. Add more toppings

5. Bake at X for Y

6. Add crushed tortilla chips

fields.name: Black Bean Southwestern Pasta Bake
fields.directions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.

1. Prepare pasta according to package directions. Drain and return to large saucepan.

1. Stir in diced tomatoes, jalapeno, corn, black beans, cumin, chili powder, 1 cup cheese, and salsa; blend gently together until all ingredients are distributed. 

1. Transfer to 3-quart non-stick baking dish and spread out evenly. 

1. Top with 2 cups shredded cheese. 

1. Bake uncovered until cheese is melted and golden, about 40 minutes.

fields.name: Vegetarian Shepherd's Pie
fields.directions: http://thefigtreeblog.com/2010/11/vegetarian-shepherds-pie-with-roasted-garlic-goat-cheese-mashed-potatoes.html
fields.description: http://thefigtreeblog.com/2010/11/vegetarian-shepherds-pie-with-roasted-garlic-goat-cheese-mashed-potatoes.html

fields.name: Sweet Potato Casserole
fields.directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. 

1. Put the sweet potatoes on a baking sheet and pierce each one 2 or 3 times with a fork.  

1. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until tender.  

1. Set aside to cool.

1. Turn the oven down to 350 degrees F.  

1. Scoop the sweet potato out of their skins and into a medium bowl.  

1. Discard the skins.  

1. Mash the potatoes until smooth.  

1. Add the eggs, butter, brown sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and the pepper to taste.  

1. Whisk the mixture until smooth.

1. Butter an 8-by-8-inch casserole.  

1. Pour the sweet potato mixture into the pan and sprinkle the top with the pecans.  

1. Bake until puffed, about 30 minutes.  

1. Serve immediately.

fields.name: Green Bean Casserole
fields.directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. 

1. Heat the olive oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat until very hot but not smoking.  

1. Add 1/4 cup shallots and cook, stirring, until golden brown and crisp, about 2 minutes.  

1. Transfer with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain.  

1. Repeat with the remaining shallots, cooking 1/4 cup at a time.  

1. Reserve the oil in the skillet.

1. Place the green beans in a steamer basket fitted over a pot of boiling water.  

1. Cover and steam until bright green and still crisp, about 3 minutes.

1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the reserved shallot oil in a large, deep nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.  

1. Add the 🍄 and cook, stirring occasionally, until the 🍄 liquid is evaporated and they begin to brown, about 12 minutes.  

1. Add the garlic and thyme and cook, stirring, 1 minute.  

1. Transfer the 🍄 mixture to a bowl.
 
1. Whisk together the milk and flour until the flour is dissolved.  

1. Add the mixture to the skillet and, whisking constantly, bring to a simmer.  

1. Reduce the heat to medium low, whisking occasionally, until thickened, 10 to 15 minutes.  

1. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the green beans, 🍄 mixture, 1/3 cup parmesan cheese, the parsley, nutmeg, 3/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.

1. Coat a 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray.  

1. Spoon the green bean mixture into the prepared dish and sprinkle the top with the crispy shallots and the remaining 2 tablespoons cheese.  

1. Bake until golden on top and bubbling, about 20 minutes.

fields.name: Veggie Pot Pies
fields.directions: http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/finalist-damaris-phillips/veggie-pot-pie-with-cornmeal-pie-crust.mobile.html
fields.description: http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/finalist-damaris-phillips/veggie-pot-pie-with-cornmeal-pie-crust.mobile.html

fields.name: Vegan Gravy
fields.directions:
1. Position an oven rack in the highest position, and preheat to 450 degrees F. 

1. Toss the onions, celery, carrots and garlic with 1 teaspoon each oil and salt on a rimmed baking sheet.  

1. Roast until the vegetables are charred in some places, 25 to 30 minutes.

1. Bring the roasted vegetables, 1 cup water, mushrooms, thyme, sun-dried tomatoes, soy sauce, bay leaf and 1 teaspoon salt to a simmer in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat.  

1. Cook, stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid is gone, 8 to 10 minutes.  

1. Add 6 cups water and 1/2 teaspoon salt, and bring back to a simmer.  

1. Reduce the heat to medium-low, and gently simmer until reduced by about one third, about 45 minutes.  

1. Strain the stock through a strainer into a large liquid measuring cup; use the back of a ladle to squeeze all the liquid out of the solids (there should be about 4 cups of stock).  

    * If not making gravy right away, let the stock cool to room temperature, then refrigerate for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 1 month.

1. To make the gravy, warm the stock slightly in a medium saucepan if it has been refrigerated.  

1. Heat the remaining 4 tablespoons oil in another medium saucepan over medium heat.  

1. Add the sage leaves, and cook until fried and crispy, about 2 minutes; remove and set aside.  

1. Add the flour to the saucepan, and stir until smooth and lightly golden, about 2 minutes.  

1. Slowly pour in the warm stock while whisking constantly until smooth and thick, 8 to 10 minutes

1. Chop up the fried sage, stir it into the gravy along with the parsley and season to taste with pepper.

fields.name: Roasted Vegetables
fields.directions:
1. Preheat oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C).

1. In a large bowl, combine the squash, red bell peppers, sweet potato, and Yukon Gold potatoes. 

1. Separate the red onion quarters into pieces, and add them to the mixture.

1. In a small bowl, stir together thyme, rosemary, olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Toss with vegetables until they are coated. Spread evenly on a large roasting pan.
    
1. Roast for 35 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven, stirring every 10 minutes, or until vegetables are cooked through and browned.

fields.name: Enchilada Sauce
fields.directions:
1. In a medium saucepan heat oil, add flour, smoothing and stirring with a wooden spoon. 

1. Cook for 1 minute. 

1. Add chili powder and cook for 30 seconds. 

1. Add stock, tomato paste, oregano, and cumin. 

1. Whisk to combine. 

1. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and cook for 15 minutes. 

1. The sauce will thicken and smooth out. 

1. Adjust the seasonings. 

1. Serve atop your favorite enchiladas.

fields.name: Black Garlic Tofu
fields.directions:
1. Press tofu with paper towels to remove water. 

1. Cut into ¾ inch cubes. 

1. Blot again.

1. Blend the black garlic cloves, oil, water, soy sauce and sugar into a paste, using a blender.

1. Heat 1 tbsp oil in wok or skillet on high heat. 

1. Add a generous pinch of salt and cracked pepper to the heating oil. 

1. When it begins to smoke, turn heat down to medium high, and carefully slide the tofu in, you don’t want it to splash.

1. Turn over tofu, every minute or so, letting it caramelize and crisp up on all sides. 
    1. This will take about 10 minutes on medium high heat. 

1. Once tofu is crispy and golden, scoop it onto a plate and set aside.

1. Carefully pour black garlic sauce into the wok and stir constantly over medium high heat, for one minute, and it will turn shiny and dark.

1. Place tofu back in wok with the sauce, stir to coat each piece well, about 30 seconds, and serve immediately. 

1. If you cook the tofu too long in the sauce, you will loose the nice crisp you created. Top with fresh chopped chives and chive blossoms.
fields.description: Crispy caramelized tofu with a fermented black garlic sauce

fields.name: Vegan Crispy Stir-Fried Tofu With Broccoli
fields.directions:
1. Heat oil in a wok to 350°F. 

1. Whisk together 1/2 cup cornstarch, flour, baking powder, and 1 teaspoon kosher salt.  

1. Add water and vodka and whisk until a smooth batter is formed, adding up to 2 tablespoons additional water if batter is too thick. It should have the consistency of thin paint and fall off of the whisk in thin ribbons that instantly disappear as they hit the surface of the batter in the bowl.

2. Add tofu slices and carefully turn to coat.  

1. Working one at a time, lift one piece and allow excess batter to drip off.  

1. Carefully lower into hot oil.  

1. Repeat with remaining tofu until wok is full.  

1. Fry, using a metal spider or slotted spatula to rotate and agitate pieces as they cook until evenly pale golden and crisp all over, about 6 minutes.  

1. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat until all tofu is fried.  

1. Carefully pour all but 1 tablespoon oil out of wok and reserve for another use.

3. Combine wine, stock, soy sauce, bean sauce, sugar, sesame oil, lemon peel and juice, and remaining 2 teaspoons corn starch in a small bowl and whisk to combine. Set aside.

4. Return wok to high heat until lightly smoking.  

1. Add broccoli and cook, stirring and tossing frequently, until lightly charred on several sides but still firm.  

1. Add garlic, ginger, and scallions and cook, tossing constantly, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Transfer broccoli and aromatics to a bowl.

5. Return skillet to high heat.  

1. Give the sauce mixture a quick whisk, then pour it into the wok.  

1. Cook, stirring, until thick and glossy, about 30 seconds. Return broccoli and tofu to pan.  

1. Add 1 tablespoon sesame seeds. Remove from heat.  

1. Turn with a wide spatula until all pieces are evenly coated.  

1. Season to taste with more salt as desired.  

1. Transfer to a serving platter, sprinkle with remaining sesame seeds, and serve immediately.
fields.description:
A quick and easy stir-fry with crisp tofu and broccoli tossed in a sweet and savory sauce with garlic, ginger, and sesame seeds.

Note: To dry tofu, line a rimmed baking sheet with paper towels. Place tofu slices on top in a single layer. Cover with another layer of paper towels and press gently to remove excess moisture.

fields.name: Potato salad
fields.directions:
Boil potatoes in salted water 10 to12 minutes, or until just tender. Drain the potatoes and spread out onto a cookie sheet to cool quickly, about 10 minutes.

In a bowl, combine celery, onion, pimento, relish, mayonnaise and mustard.

When you are ready to serve, combine cooled potatoes with other ingredients. Stir the potatoes to combine and season with salt and pepper.

fields.name: Lemon-Mustard Potato Salad
fields.directions:
Place an oven rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line a heavy baking sheet with parchment paper. Set aside.

For the dressing: In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, mustard, thyme, salt, pepper and lemon zest until smooth. Remove 3 tablespoons of the dressing and reserve.

For the salad: Add the potatoes to the bowl and toss until coated with dressing. Arrange the potatoes in an even layer on the prepared baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until golden and tender, about 40 minutes.

In a large bowl, toss together the reserved 3 tablespoons dressing, bell peppers and arugula. Arrange on a platter. Place the roasted potatoes on top and sprinkle with the gorgonzola cheese and chopped walnuts if using.

fields.name: Easy Chili Mac
fields.directions:
Make macaroni.

Mix kidney beans and corn in a skillet. Saute for 5 minutes.

In a small skillet, brown veggie crumbles for 5 minutes.

Mix crumbles and can of chili into the large skillet with the kidney beans and corn.

Serve separate in case the kiddies don't want the chili.

fields.name: Adjective Placeholder 🍄 Lasagna
fields.directions: directions

fields.name: Orecchiette with White Beans and Spinach
fields.directions:
1. Heat the oil and garlic in a large deep skillet over medium heat until the garlic is lightly golden brown, about 2 minutes.

1. Remove from heat, add 4 cups water and whisk in the bouillon base.

1. Add the orecchiette and thyme and bring to a boil.

1. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring frequently, until the orecchiette is firm-tender, 10 to 12 minutes.

1. Fold in the beans, spinach, Parmesan and 1/2 tsp pepper and cook until the beans are heated through, about 2 minutes.

fields.name: Southwest Tofu Scramble
fields.directions: Asdf
fields.description: Asdf

fields.name: Berry, 🍌, & Oat Smoothie
fields.directions:
Blend ingredients. 
Serve chilled.
fields.description: description

fields.name: Cranberry Sauce
fields.directions: In a medium sized saucepan over medium heat, dissolve the sugar in the orange juice. Stir in the cranberries and cook until the cranberries start to pop (about 10 minutes). Remove from heat and place sauce in a bowl. Cranberry sauce will thicken as it cools.

fields.name: Chocolate Mousse - Low Carb
fields.directions:
1. Whip the cream with electric mixer.

1. Add Equal one packet at a time.

1. Add vanilla and cocoa powder, and beat until almost stiff.

1. Scrape down and mix again.

1. Place in serving dishes, cover, and refrigerate for at least 1/2 hour.

1. Serve within 4 hours of preparation.
fields.description: Low carb dessert

fields.name: Vanilla Ice Cream - Zero Carb
fields.directions: Add the heavy whipping cream, stevia, and vanilla to a bowl and whip until combined.

fields.name: Really Good Alfredo and Chorizo and Egg and Veggies Goo Pile
fields.directions:
1. Chop up the onion, bell pepper, and mushrooms however you like. 

1. Sautée those in some olive oil until they smell good. I like to use a wok so I can push stuff out of the way while I cook something else. 

1. In a bowl, combine 3 eggs and half a cup of heavy cream. Whip vigorously until it looks like it has been vigorously whipped. 

1. Dump the egg mix into the wok and scramble them until they look like scrambled eggs. If you get veggies in there, not a problem, but try to keep them off to the side. 

1. Once the eggs are scrambled, make a trench to either side. Dump the alfredo sauce on one side and the chorizo on the other. It doesn't matter how you arrange it, but the eggs make a nice barrier. If the chorizo is frozen, nuke it in the microwave for 30 seconds.

1. Get the alfredo sauce and chorizo steamy.

1. Mix it all together, with gusto!

1. Enjoy. Also with gusto!
fields.description:
Gooey, but in a good way. 

Also low carb.

fields.name: Cream Cheese Pancakes
fields.directions:
1. Put all ingredients in a blender or magic bullet. Blend until smooth. Let rest for 2 minutes so the bubbles can settle.

1. Pour ¼ of the batter into a hot pan greased with butter or pam spray. Cook for 2 minutes until golden, flip and cook 1 minute on the other side. Repeat with the rest of the batter.

1. Serve with sugar free syrup (or any syrup of your choice) and fresh berries. (I like to use the heavy whipping cream in the canister from Costco.)
fields.description: Low carb, taste like french toast; calories: 344; fat: 29g; carbs: 2.5g net; protein: 17g

fields.name: Low Carb Pizza
fields.directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees.  

1. Microwave 1.5 cup mozzarella and cream cheese in a bowl until soft, about 35 seconds.  

1. Add egg, almond flour, pizza seasoning (equal parts oregano and basil) and blend well into a dough ball.  

1. Press into a circle shape or square shape pizza on a parchment lined baking sheet sprayed with a thin coating of olive oil or coconut oil.  

1. Sprinkle garlic salt and basil over surface of pizza crust. Poke few holes with fork to the crust from rising while baking.

1. Bake crust in oven for 8-10 mins. Then broil (cook top) for 1-2 minutes.

1. Add sauce and remaining half cup of mozzarella.

1. Pop back in oven for 4-5 more minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.
fields.description: per serving: calories: 187; fat: 14g; net carb 4g; protein 11g

fields.name: Eggplant Stuffed (Imam Bayildi)
fields.directions: f
fields.description: f

fields.name: Punch - Sparkling Cranberry Kiss
fields.directions: In a pitcher, combine cranberry juice and orange juice. Just before serving, stir in ginger ale; serve over ice. If desired, serve with orange slices. Yield: 14 servings (3/4 cup each).

fields.name: Punch - Pretty Pink Punch
fields.directions: In a punch bowl, dissolve sugar in water. Add juices and lemonade; mix well. Stir in ginger ale. If desired, top with a decorative ice mold and lemon slices. Serve immediately. Yield: 50 servings (7-1/2 quarts).

fields.name: Punch - Party Punch III
fields.directions: In a punch bowl, combine fruit punch and orange juice. Slowly pour ginger ale down the side of the bowl to retain carbonation.

fields.name: Keto Vegetable 🐔 Soup
fields.directions:
1. In a large soup pot, cook the bacon and olive oil over medium heat for 2 minutes.
1. Add the onions, garlic, sundried tomatoes, and mushrooms. Cook for 5 minutes.
1. Pour in the chicken stock and water, then add the celery root and chicken. Simmer for 15 minutes.
1. Add the squash, green beans, and swiss chard and simmer for 10 minutes.
1. Add the red wine vinegar and season with salt and pepper to taste.
1. Stir in the fresh basil just before serving.
fields.description:
* Low Carb, Paleo, Whole 30. 
* This delicious low carb soup recipe is loaded with healthy veggies and chicken. 
* Serving size: 1.5 cups
* Approx nutrition info per 1.5 cup serving: 
  - 136 calories, 4g fat, 4g net carbs, 19g protein

fields.name: Egg Salad
fields.directions:
1. Place eggs in a pot and add enough water to cover eggs by at least one inch.
Quickly bring the water to a boil, then remove from heat and let the eggs sit in the hot water for 15 minutes.
1. Remove eggs from hot water and immediately place them in a bowl filled with ice until they're cooled completely.
1. Peel the cooled eggs and dice or mash them.
1. Mix together mayonnaise and mustard; combine with the eggs.
1. Add salt and pepper to taste.
1. Refrigerate for at least an hour to allow the flavors to combine.
fields.description: Tasty. Mustardy. Mayonaisey. Eggy.

fields.name: Mini Onion Cheese Muffins
fields.directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
1. Line a mini muffin tin with paper muffin cups.
1. In a small bowl, stir together dry ingredients, than add wet ingredients and mix well.
1. Spoon into mini muffin tin, mounding up above edge of each cup.
1. Bake for about 20 minutes or until golden on the edges.
1. Let cool for about 1 hour before serving. Otherwise the papers will stick.
fields.description: Makes 12 mini biscuits. Note: These have a tendency to get soggy over time. For next day goodness, warm them again at 300 degrees F for about 10 minutes.

fields.name: Keto 🌮 Meatballs
fields.directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
1. Saute onions in butter until translucent, then remove from heat, and cool for 10 minutes.
1. While onions are cooling, shred the Colby Jack cheese, and then mince the shreds in a food processor until crumbly.  Set aside.                           
1. In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta cheese and egg. Whisk until smooth.
1. Add the spices, salt, and pepper and mix.
1. Add onions and minced Colby Jack cheese.  Mix well.
1. Add beef and mix until all ingredients are combined .
1. Divide meat mixture into 1.25 ounce portions. You should end up with about 25 equal sized pieces.
1. Roll each piece into a ball.
1. Place the meatballs on a 🍪 sheet, and bake at 350 degrees until cooked through and brown, about 20 minutes.
fields.description:
Divided into 25 – 1.25 ounce meatballs: each meatball has 75 calories, 5 g fat, 1 net carb, 6 g protein
Entire recipe: 1871 calories, 124 grams of fat, 29 carbs, 4 grams fiber, 155 grams of protein.

fields.name: Italian Meatballs (Keto)
fields.directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper to make cleanup easier.
1. Saute onions in olive oil until translucent, then remove from heat, and cool for 10 minutes.
1. While onions are cooling, mince the shredded Parmesan in a food processor until fine grained.  Set aside.                           
1. In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta cheese and egg. Whisk until smooth.
1. Add the spices, salt, and pepper and mix.
1. Add onions and minced Parmesan cheese.  Mix well.
1. Add beef and mix until all ingredients are combined .
1. Divide meat mixture into 1 ounce portions. You should end up with about 30-31 equal sized pieces.
1. Roll each piece into a ball.
1. Place the meatballs on a cookie sheet, and bake at 350 degrees until cooked through and brown, about 20 minutes.
fields.description:
Assuming 31 total, each meatball has 64 calories, 4 g fat, 1 carb, 6 g protein
Entire recipe has 1992 calories, 128 g fat, 34 g carb, 5 g fiber, 171 g protein

fields.name: Swedish Meatballs (Keto)
fields.directions:
# Out-of-the-box Version
1. Saute onions in butter until translucent, then remove from heat, and cool for 10 minutes.
1. While onions are cooling, shred the swiss cheese, and then mince the shreds to a fine crumble in a food processor. Set aside.
1. In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta cheese and egg and whisk. 
1. Add the spices, salt, and pepper and mix.  
1. Add onions and swiss cheese and mix until smooth.
1. Add the turkey and mix until all ingredients are combined into a non sticky "dough".
1. Divide meat mixture into 30 - 1 ounce sized pieces. 
1. Roll each piece into a ball. 
1. Place the meatballs on a cookie sheet, and bake at 350 degrees until cooked through and brown, about 20 minutes.

# Alternate version/notes

1. Replace swiss and ricotta cheeses with mozzarella. I food-processed 1.5 cups and it turned out pretty crumbly.
1. I also used egg/cream mix(2 eggs and 1/6 cup heavy cream (that's 2 2/3 tbsp (I know both of these units are a little awkward, but I was actually prepping egg wraps and happened to already have made this cream/egg mixture with 1 cup cream and 12 eggs))) which made it really runny. I added a cup of almond flour to balance it out.
1. To portion them, I used what is apparently called a disher to scoop the meatballs so I didn't get all gooey (they were still pretty gooey). This worked out great.
fields.description:
Assuming 30 -1 ounce portions, each meatball has 62 calories, 4 g fat, 1 carb, 5 g protein

Entire recipe has 1861 calories, 121 g of fat, 32 g carb, 3 g fiber, 157 g protein

fields.name: Veggie Bites (Keto)
fields.directions:
1. Whip the cream cheese until fluffy.
1. Add the cream and sour cream. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well.
1. Spoon into pre-baked miniature tart crusts.
1. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees F or until bubbly.
fields.description: Prerequisite: http://eatables-menu.herokuapp.com/71/recipe_details/

fields.name: Almond Flour Tart Shells (Base)
fields.directions:
1. Place the almond flour in a medium mixing bowl and add the butter. Mix well.
1. Add the eggs and salt and mix throughly. The dough should come together, and pull away from the sides of the bowl and start to make a ball as you mix it. If it still seems sticky, add a little more almond flour and keep mixing until you get to a dough consistency that can be rolled out.
1. Place the dough ball between two sheets of parchment paper.
1. Using a heavy rolling pin, roll the dough out into a 10" x 16" rectangle with about a 1/4 inch thickness.
1. For miniature tarts, use a 2" biscuit cutter to cut circles into the dough. Put a miniature cupcake paper into each well of a miniature cupcake pan.
1. Take each dough circle and carefully press it into a paper cup. This is easier if you use a Mini Tart Shaper.
1. If the dough breaks, just add a bits of dough into the holes and press again with the tart shaper.
1. Bake at 350 degrees F for about 5-6 minutes or until edges are golden.
fields.description: This low carb pie crust is based on almond flour, and actually tastes better than a conventional wheat flour based crust.

fields.name: Keto 🌮 Bites
fields.directions:
1. In a medium skillet, saute onions in butter until soft.
1. Add the ground beef and saute until brown and cooked through.
1. Add the chilies and spices and simmer for 5 minutes.
1. Turn down heat and add sour cream and cheese.
1. Simmer on low for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally to mix.
1. Spoon into pre-baked miniature low carb pie crusts. http://eatables-menu.herokuapp.com/71/recipe_details/
1. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees F or until bubbly.
fields.description: These low carb appetizers are easy to make and really delicious, and very popular at parties and potlucks.

fields.name: Egg 🦃 🥓 Wraps
fields.directions:
1. Crack the eggs into a mixing bowl.
1. Add the cream
1. Beat until smooth
1. Cover the bottom of a non-stick pan with the egg mixture.
1. Add a dash of salt.
1. Cook for about 2 minutes or until the egg has set.
1. Use a large spatula to flip the egg.
1. Cook for an additional 30 seconds and remove.
1. Repeat until you are out of egg mixture. You should end up with 4-5 egg 'tortillas'.
1. Meanwhile, cook the 🦃 🥓 in a separate pan.
1. Cut the 🦃 🥓 slices in half.
fields.description:
Egg-wrapped 🦃 🥓. Easy on-the-go keto breakfast.

Nutrition per serving: 7g of fat (2 saturated, 2 monounsaturated, 1 polyunsaturated) and 7g of protein. 0 net carbs.

fields.name: Irish Cream Liqueur (Keto)
fields.directions:
1. In medium saucepan, whisk together the stevia/erythritol granulated sweetener and cocoa powder until cocoa powder is completely combined and no lumps remained.

1. Whisk in instant coffee granules.

1. Whisk in egg yolks to make a paste. Add 1 cup of cream very gradually, about a tablespoon at a time. Reserve remaining 1 1/4 cup cream.

1. Heat over low heat to medium-low heat, whisking frequently until mixture has thickened slightly. This occurs at about 200º F. Do not allow mixture to boil. Remove from heat and allow to cool.

1. Whisk in the remaining 1 1/4 cups cream, vanilla extract and whiskey.

1. Store refrigerated in a tightly sealed glass jar.

----
Per 1/18th of recipe (about 1 ounce):

- Calories: 131
- Fat (g): 8
- Carbs (g): 0
- Fiber (g): 0
- Protein (g) 1
fields.description:
This Low-Carb Irish Cream Liqueur recipe tastes like the real thing, but with fewer carbs. The lower carbohydrate content helps it work for people on low-carb, LC/HF, ketogenic, Atkins, diabetic and Banting diets. This recipe does contain alcohol, so don’t drink this if your doctor recommends refraining from drinking alcoholic beverages.

Makes 18 1-ounce servings (like that's enough)

fields.name: Creamy Peanut Butter Mousse (Keto)
fields.directions:
1. Pour the cream into a mixing bowl and beat with an electric mixer until peaks form, about 2-3 minutes.
1. Scoop the whipped cream into a small bowl and place in refrigerator.
1. Combine the cream cheese, peanut butter and vanilla in a mixing bowl and beat until smooth, about 2 minutes.
1. Add powdered sugar and beat again for another minute.
1. Add the milk and beat until smooth, about 20-30 seconds.
1. Use a spatula to gently fold and stir in the whipped cream until combined. Transfer to an 8-inch square pan (can also serve in individual serving dishes or trifles).
1. Top with shaved chocolate and chopped peanuts, if desired.
1. Serve immediately or chill until firm. I cut it into squares after chilling it and served on dessert plates. Enjoy!
fields.description: This rich, Creamy Peanut Butter Mousse dessert recipe takes ten minutes to make and will not fail to impress for an every day treat, holidays, or birthdays!

fields.name: Almond Flour Waffles – Gluten Free
fields.directions:
1. In large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder and salt.

1. Stir in oil and eggs. Mix until blended. Slowly add heavy cream until desired batter thickness is achieved. 

1. Pour into waffle maker to cook.

fields.name: Taco Stuff Meal Prep
fields.directions: Things

fields.name: Candied Sweet Potatoes
fields.directions:
1. Scrub sweet potatoes, but do not peel.
1. Place potatoes in 3-quart saucepan. Add enough water just to cover. Heat to boiling. 
1. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 20 to 25 minutes or until tender.
1. Drain; cool slightly. Slip off skins. Cut into 1/2-inch slices.
2. Heat remaining ingredients in 10-inch skillet over medium heat, stirring constantly, until smooth and bubbly.
1. Add potatoes.
1. Gently stir until glazed and hot.

fields.name: Stuffing
fields.directions: Mix it all up and sweeten to taste
fields.description:
3 lb apples
1/2 cup raisins
3 eggs
1lb bread
1/2 cup milk
1/4 cup sugar

fields.name: Quick Roast 🦃
fields.directions:
1. In a medium size bowl, stir onion powder, salt, cracked black pepper, paprika, rosemary, thyme and sage. Set aside.

1. Remove the rack from the roaster oven. Cover and heat oven to 325°F.

1. Remove giblets and neck from cavities of turkey. Set aside and use for giblet gravy.

1. Place turkey on rack. Stuff cavity with onion and celery. Brush turkey with butter or oil. Rub turkey with seasoning mixture.

1. Using handles on rack, place rack with turkey in roaster oven and cook 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until meat thermometer registers 165°F.
fields.description: In a turkey roaster oven

fields.name: Green Bean Casserole Crescent Cups
fields.directions:
1
Heat oven to 375°F. Lightly spray 16 regular-size muffin cups with cooking spray.
2
Unroll each can of dough. To make 2 large rectangles, pinch seams and perforations to seal. Cut each rectangle of dough into 8 equal squares. Line each muffin cup by pressing 1 dough square in bottom and up sides of cup.

3
In large bowl, stir together soup, milk, Worcestershire sauce and dash ground black pepper with whisk until smooth. Add drained green beans, 1/2 cup of the cheese and 2/3 cup of the onions; gently stir until combined. Divide mixture evenly among dough-lined cups.

4
Bake 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Divide remaining cheese and onions evenly onto tops of cups. Return to oven; bake 5 minutes longer or until onions and cups are golden brown. Cool in pans 5 minutes. Remove from cups; serve warm.
fields.description:
2
cans (8 oz each) Pillsbury™ refrigerated crescent dinner rolls SAVE $
1
can (10 oz) condensed cream of mushroom soup
1/2
cup milk
1
teaspoon Worcestershire Sauce
2
cans (15 oz each) green beans, drained
1
cup shredded Cheddar cheese (4 oz)
1 1/2
cups French-fried onions

fields.name: Toasted Pecans
fields.directions:
1. Melt butter.

1. Toss pecans with the butter until evenly coated.

1. Place in an oven preheated to 275F.

1. Toast for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes to ensure even cooking.

1. When done, place nuts on a cooling rack covered with paper towels.

1. Salt the toasted pecans to your liking.

1. Store in an airtight container when cool.

1. You can even freeze these for later
fields.description: Mmm

fields.name: CREAMY MACARONI AND CHEESE CASSEROLE
fields.directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees.

1. Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain and run under cold water.

1. Melt butter over medium heat in a large saucepan. Whisk in flour and let cook 2 minutes while stirring. Slowly whisk in cream, milk, mustard powder and onion powder. Cook over medium heat while stirring until thickened.

1. Remove from heat and stir in parmesan cheese & 3 cups cheddar cheese until melted. Add soup if using.

1. Toss cheese sauce & macaroni noodles together. Pour into a greased 9×13 pan. Top with remaining cheese.

1. Bake 18-24 minutes or until bubbly. Do not over cook. Cool 10-15 minutes before serving.
fields.description:
MENU
      
GET WEEKLY RECIPES

GO »

JUNE 27, 2015
CREAMY MACARONI AND CHEESE CASSEROLE
This post may contain affiliate links. Please read my disclosure policy.
This homemade Macaroni and Cheese Casserole is a show stopper! Not only is this creamy mac and cheese recipe easy to make it, has a special ingredient making it extra delicious!  This dish has so much velvety cheese in a quick homemade sauce and once you try it, this is going to be the only macaroni & cheese you make!


Report this ad

This Creamy Mac and Cheese Casserole is a show stopper! It's easy to make with tons of rich cheese sauce and a secret ingredient making it extra delicious!

HOW TO MAKE CREAMY MAC AND CHEESE

PIN IT TO YOUR DINNER BOARD TO SAVE IT FOR LATER!

Follow Spend With Pennies on Pinterest for more great recipes!


Report this ad

Hello, my name is Holly and I am addicted to Macaroni and Cheese.  It is literally my favorite thing to eat on the whole planet!  I love crock pot mac & cheese, stove top mac and cheese or even out of a little blue box.

Of all of the mac and cheese recipes, *this* little gem right here is like striking mac and cheese gold. It is definitely the best macaroni and cheese casserole ever and always gets rave reviews! Take it from me, I definitely should know!

It’s pretty quick to make from scratch and extra cheesy and delicious!  Now, this recipe has a special ingredient that makes it extra yummy…  AND it is optional.  The addition of the cheddar soup makes the sauce a little extra velvety and just adds a little something.  If you don’t happen to have it on hand (or just don’t want to use it), this recipe is still ridiculously great without.


Report this ad

For the light cream, I use a cream that is about 10-12%MF or half and half.

REPIN this recipe!

Creamy Mac and cheese has tender macaroni noodles loaded with mounds of velvety cheese sauce. This the most incredible baked macaroni you've ever had!

TIPS TO MAKE CREAMY MAC & CHEESE

Cook your PASTA AL DENTE (FIRM) as the noodles cook extra in the sauce and you don’t want them mushy.
Don’t forget to SALT YOUR PASTA WATER.
While not everyone agrees with RINSING THE PASTA after cooking, in this particular recipe it stops the noodles from cooking and the sauce is created with a texture that pairs perfectly with the rinsed noodles.
A SHARPER CHEDDAR CHEESE will add a stronger cheese flavor.
Pre-shredded cheeses contain additives to keep it from sticking together which affects the way it melts.  The sauce is best if you SHRED YOUR OWN CHEESES.
Allowing the baked macaroni and cheese to rest for a few minutes after baking will THICKEN THE SAUCE.
Most importantly of all… DO NOT OVER BAKE THIS RECIPE.

Report this ad

When cooking your macaroni noodles, cook them according to the package directions but you want them to be still firm.  If your package says 6-8 minutes, just cook them 6…  you get the idea.

I choose not to top this casserole with a bread crumb mixture but if you really like bread crumbs on your macaroni and cheese, by all means, add some! Just mix 3/4 cup bread crumbs (panko is best) and 3 tablespoons melted butter with the topping cheese.  Sprinkle on top before baking.

This recipe makes an extra saucy creamy macaroni.  Do not over-bake this recipe.  You want it creamy and rich, over-baking will cause it to dry out.  I found that 20 minutes was perfect in my oven…  note that the recipe will thicken slightly while standing.


Report this ad




YIELD: 8 SERVINGS TOTAL TIME: 45 MINUTES PREP TIME: 20 MINUTES COOK TIME: 25 MINUTES
CREAMY MACARONI AND CHEESE CASSEROLE
This Creamy Macaroni and Cheese Casserole is a show stopper! Not only is this mac and cheese recipe easy to make it has a special ingredient making it extra delicious! This dish has so much velvety cheese in a quick homemade sauce and once you try it, this is going to be the only macaroni & cheese you make!

PRINT RECIPE
5
5 / 5 (12 Reviews)
Did you make this recipe? LEAVE A REVIEW »
INGREDIENTS:
12 oz dry macaroni
1/4 cup butter
1/4 cup flour
1 1/2 cups milk
1 cup light cream (about 10-12% MF)
1/2 teaspoon dry mustard powder
1 teaspoon onion powder
salt & pepper to taste
1 can condensed cream of cheddar soup (optional)
4 cups sharp cheddar , divided
1/2 cup fresh parmesan cheese

fields.name: "Curry" Paste
fields.directions:
1. Mix ingredients in bowl
1. Baste something
fields.description: For basting

fields.name: Wild 🍚 🐔 Soup
fields.directions:
INGREDIENTS

* 1/4 cup butter
* 1 1/2 cups celery
* 1 1/2 cups carrots
* 1 medium onion
* 8 oz mushrooms
* 1 1/2 tbsp chicken base
* 1 1/8 tsp poultry seasoning
* 1 1/8 tsp nature's seasoning
* 1/4 tsp pepper
* 1 cup flour
* 6 cups chicken broth
* 1/4 tbsp kitchen bouquet
* 3 cups half & half or heavy cream
* 2 cups cooked wild rice (1 cup uncooked rice to 2 cups water in rice cooker)
* 4 chicken breasts cubed (cooked)
* 1 1/2 tbsp parsley

DIRECTIONS

1. Make rice in the rice cooker.
1. Chop vegetables.
1. Cube and brown chicken.
1. Melt butter and saute carrots, celery, and onions in large pot. Add chicken base and spices. Cook for 5-8 minutes.
1. Alternately, add flour and broth slowly to maintain heating. Add cream, mushrooms, chicken, wild rice, and parsley. 
1. Bring to a very slow boil. Cook gently for 30-60 to blend flavors.
fields.description:
Chicken and Wild Rice Soup
Yield 8 servings

fields.name: Instant Pot 🐔 Breasts From Frozen
fields.directions:
Ingredients

* 4 frozen boneless skinless 🐔 breasts (mine were about 7-8 ounces or 200g each frozen)
* 1 cup water or 🐔 broth
salt and pepper

Instructions

1. Place 🐔 breasts in the bottom of the Instant Pot (no need to use the trivet!) -- it's okay if they're stacked, just make sure none are stuck together.

1. Pour in the water or 🐔 broth (or use another liquid like 🍍 juice, apple juice, etc.) and season with salt and pepper.

1. Put the lid on and move the valve to sealing. Press Manual pressure and set the timer to 10-12 minutes (I've found 10 is just right, and at the 12 minute mark they are 180 degrees F or more). The Instant Pot will take about 10 minutes to come to pressure and start counting down from 10.

1. When the cook time is up, let pressure release naturally for 5-10 minutes before releasing the remaining pressure. Check that the internal temperature of the 🐔 is 165 degrees F -- mine is always at least or higher.

1. Serve as is, chop, or add sauces as desired.

fields.comment: Drain and rinse corn and beans, first time it was way soupy
Subbed Chile powder for pepper flakes to much approval
Included half a cup quarter sliced cucumber, 1 cup quarter sliced zucchini
Subbed frozen mixed veggies for frozen peas  (peas, corn, carrots, green beans)
Skip the soy sauce, add more Chile powder (1 tsp total)
Don't soak the potatoes after grating, they take longer to brown in the pan

Too many pepper pieces
Pepper pieces too big
Could use more seasoning
Didn't peel potatoes, added sautéed mushrooms. Tasty.
Don't freeze the broth/potato mix, makes the potatoes tough and they don't soften very nicely.
I didn't have any of those cheeses except grated parmesan. I substituted with cheddar jack and mozzarella.

Used dried bay leaves instead 

Equivalents
1 whole bay leaf = 1/8 to 1/4 tsp crushed or 1/4 to 1/2 tsp broken
Changed rosemary to a pinch. Most excellent.
Ideas. 1. More cheese less flour 2. Real butter. 3. Whole wheat flour
1 whole bay leaf = 1/8 to 1/4 tsp crushed or 1/4 to 1/2 tsp broken
Use the Teflon pan. The hash browns don't brown correctly in the ceramic.
My pan is not big enough for 8 cups stock + 3 cups water. Used 4 14.5 oz cans of stock (7 cups 2 oz), and that seems to be enough
Sun-dried tomatoes make the soup smell awesome.
Original recipe called for 1 tsp instant coffee, but I don't think that's enough. Updated to 2 tsp. 3/4 whiskey might not be enough either; I used 9/8 cup (3/4 and half of 3/4)
Used scotch whiskey, so the first batch was Odle's Scottish Whiskey!
1 cup cream is way too much. Did not bind in iron. Try half, and lots of cooking spray
5 hours in the roaster with foil covering under the lid at 400 deg
Turmeric is expected in a curry, but it stains everything. Use 6 tbsp if that's fine.
